subject: CHINLANG
title: First-Year Modern Chinese, First Quarter
description: Conversation, grammar, reading, elementary composition. Daily sections may be set at the beginning of the quarter to suit schedule requirements.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Accelerated First-Year Chinese
description: This Chinese language course is designed for students with no previous knowledge of the language.  The goal is to develop communicative competence in listening, speaking, reading and writing skills at the elementary level.

subject: CHINLANG
title: First-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, First Quarter
description: This is the first of a 3-course sequence (Chinlang1B, 2B, 3B)for students with some speaking skills, but with limited or no writing and reading skills in Mandarin Chinese. The course focuses on introducing a functional vocabulary and grammatical structures through culturally related topics in order to enhance the students literacy and communicative competence.

subject: CHINLANG
title: First-Year Modern Chinese, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 1.  Daily sections may be set at the beginning of the quarter to suit schedule requirements.Prerequisite: placement test, CHINLANG 1.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Accelerated First Year Chinese course, part 2
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 1 or 1A.  For students with previous knowledge of Chinese. Practice listening, speaking, reading and writing skills.  Further development of socially and culturally appropriate proficiency in interpersonal, interpretive and presentational spheres.Prerequisites: CHINLANG 1or 1A , or Placement Test. Fulfills the University Foreign Language Requirement

subject: CHINLANG
title: First-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of Chinlang1B.  The course continues to introduces a functional vocabulary and grammatical structures through culturally related topics in order to enhance the students literacy and communicative competence.  Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 1B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: First-Year Modern Chinese, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 2. Daily sections may be set at the beginning of the quarter to suit schedule requirements. Fulfills the University language requirement. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 2.

subject: CHINLANG
title: First-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 2B. The course continues to introduce a functional vocabulary and grammatical structures through culturally related topics in order to enhance the students literacy and communicative competence. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 2B or consent of the instructor. Fulfills University language requirement.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Character Writing Lab for Intermediate Speakers of Mandarin
description: This specialized practicum in the basics of hand writing Chinese characters is for students intending to subsequently enroll in 2nd Year Chinese, 2nd Quarter (either regular or heritage track) in Winter 2022.  Eligibility must be based on the results of your Mandarin Placement test completed prior to the start of Autumn Quarter, which specifically provide the option to take this supplemental course.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Conversational Chinese, First Quarter
description: This is the first of a 3-course sequence in Beginning Mandarin (CHINLANG 6, 7, 8) that focuses on developing basic oral communication skills. Hanyu pinyin is used (no reading/writing of Chinese characters is required), with special emphasis on developing accurate pronunciation. Students will learn to: a) introduce themselves in an informal social situation, b) engage in simple transactions, c) converse about themselves, their friends and families, and d) talk about activities in their daily lives.

sections.notes: This class section has been cancelled!

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Conversational Chinese, Second Quarter
description: This is the second of a 3-course sequence in Beginning Mandarin (CHINLANG 6, 7, 8) that focuses on developing basic oral communication skills. Prerequisite is Beginning Conversational Chinese, First Quarter (CHINLANG 6) or equivalent. Hanyu pinyin is used (no reading/writing of Chinese characters required), with emphasis on supporting accurate pronunciation. Students will continue to build speaking proficiency across practical topics related to daily activities, social life, and studies.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Conversational Chinese, Third Quarter
description: This is the third of a 3-course sequence in Beginning Mandarin (CHINLANG 6, 7, 8) that focuses on developing basic oral communication skills. Hanyupinyin is used (no reading/writing of Chinese characters required). Students will continue to build speaking proficiency across practical topics including shopping and transportation.Prerequisite is Beginning Conversational Chinese, Second Quarter (CHINLANG 7) or equivalent.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning-Intermediate Conversational Chinese
description: This is the first of a 3-course sequence in Beginning to Intermediate level Mandarin oral communication.  (Hanyu pinyin is used; no knowledge of Chinese characters is required.)  Prerequisite is the Beginning Conversational Chinese sequence (CHINLANG 6,7,8) or equivalent.  Students will continue to build speaking proficiency across a variety of practical content areas including Weather, Food & Dining, Asking Directions, and Health.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning-Intermediate Conversational Chinese, Second Quarter
description: This is the second of a 3-course sequence in Beginning to Intermediate level Mandarin oral communication.  (Hanyu pinyin is used; no knowledge of Chinese characters is required.)  Prerequisite is CHINLANG 9A or the equivalent.  Students will further develop speaking proficiency across a variety of practical content areas.including Health, Social Life, and Living Accommodations.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning-Intermediate Conversational Chinese, Third Quarter
description: This is the third of a 3-course sequence in Beginning to Intermediate level Mandarin oral communication.  (Hanyu pinyin is used; no knowledge of Chinese characters is required.)  Prerequisite is CHINLANG 9B or the equivalent.  Students will further develop speaking proficiency across a variety of practical content areas including Sports and Travel..

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Southern Min (Taiwanese) Conversation, First Quarter
description: This is the first of a 3-course sequence in Beginning Southern Min -Taiwanese (CHINLANG 10, 11, 12) that focuses on developing basic oral communication skills. No reading/writing of Chinese characters is required.It is designed to equip students with the basic language skills needed in everyday life situations.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Southern Min (Taiwanese) Conversation, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of Chinlang10.  The course focuses on developing basic oral communication skills. No reading/writing of Chinese characters is required.It is designed to equip students with the basic language skills needed in everyday life situations. Prerequisite or consent of instructor

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Southern Min (Taiwanese) Conversation, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of Chinlang 11. The course focuses on developing basic oral communication skills. No reading/writing of Chinese characters is required.It is designed to equip students with the basic language skills. needed in everyday life situations. Prerequisite: Chinlang  11 or consent of instructor

subject: CHINLANG
title: First- Year Cantonese, First quarter
description: This is a 5-unit each, three-quarter series of First Year Cantonese for beginners. The primary objective of the series is to introduce to students the Cantonese language and culture through engaging activities in daily life situations to enhance speaking, listening, reading and writing skills at the beginning level. By the end of the year, students will acquire the knowledge of the sound system, basic grammar, and the ability to converse, as well as read and write the most basic Cantonese characters, needed in daily-life communication. Authentic materials and appropriate online resources are incorporated in the communicative activities and guided practices of the course to facilitate Cantonese learning.

subject: CHINLANG
title: First -Year Cantonese, Second Quarter
description: This is a 5-unit each, three-quarter series of First Year Cantonese for beginners. The primary objective of the series is to introduce to students the Cantonese language and culture through engaging activities in daily life situations to enhance speaking, listening, reading and writing skills at the beginning level. By the end of the year, students will acquire the knowledge of the sound system, basic grammar, and the ability to converse, as well as read and write the most basic Cantonese characters, needed in daily-life communication. Authentic materials and appropriate online resources are incorporated in the communicative activities and guided practices of the course to facilitate Cantonese learning.

subject: CHINLANG
title: First-Year Cantonese, Third Quarter
description: This is a 5-unit each, three-quarter series of First Year Cantonese for beginners. The primary objective of the series is to introduce to students the Cantonese language and culture through engaging activities in daily life situations to enhance speaking, listening, reading and writing skills at the beginning level. By the end of the year, students will acquire the knowledge of the sound system, basic grammar, and the ability to converse, as well as read and write the most basic Cantonese characters, needed in daily-life communication. Authentic materials and appropriate online resources are incorporated in the communicative activities and guided practices of the course to facilitate Cantonese learning.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Conversational Cantonese, First Quarter
description: Beginning Conversational Cantonese, 2 units series is 15, 16 and 17This is the first of a restructured 3-course series of beginning Cantonese for both Chinese and non-Chinese speakers. The primary objective of this beginning series is to introduce students to the Cantonese language and culture through engaging activities designed to build up their speaking and listening skills needed in traveling, studying, living, or working in Cantonese-speaking communities. The main goals are to enable students to (1) introduce themselves and communicate in daily life situations on topics of personal interest, etc., (2) understand the general ideas in familiar contexts, (3) become familiar with and/or participate in some cultural practices and products in the Cantonese-speaking world. Authentic materials such as classic and popular Cantopop, movie clips, or TV show clips are incorporated in the courses and appropriate online resources are used to facilitate learning.  No Prerequisite.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Conversational Cantonese for Standard Modern Chinese Speakers, First Quarter
description: This is the first of the 3-course series on beginning Cantonese for Standard Modern Chinese speakers.  The primary objective of the beginning series is to help students build up a repertoire of vocabulary so that they can: (a) introduce themselves in an informal social situation, (b) engage in simple transactions, (c) converse about themselves, their friends and families, and (d) talk about activities in daily lives.  Authentic materials such as Cantopop and movie clips are incorporated in the courses and Internet tools are used to enhance learning.  There is also an optional field trip to a karaoke bar, a dim sum restaurant, or a Cantonese community every quarter to experience Cantonese culture. In addition, students work on common pronunciation and grammatical errors due to influences from Mandarin. Cantonese-Chinese characters will also be taught.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Cantonese Conversation, Second Quarter
description: Beginning Conversational Cantonese, 2 units series is 15, 16 and 17This is the first of a restructured 3-course series of beginning Cantonese for both Chinese and non-Chinese speakers. The primary objective of this beginning series is to introduce students to the Cantonese language and culture through engaging activities designed to build up their speaking and listening skills needed in traveling, studying, living, or working in Cantonese-speaking communities. The main goals are to enable students to (1) introduce themselves and communicate in daily life situations on topics of personal interest, etc., (2) understand the general ideas in familiar contexts, (3) become familiar with and/or participate in some cultural practices and products in the Cantonese-speaking world. Authentic materials such as classic and popular Cantopop, movie clips, and TV show clips are incorporated in the courses and appropriate online resources are used to facilitate learning.  No Prerequisite.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Conversational Cantonese for Mandarin Speakers, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 15M. This is the second of the 3-course series on beginning Cantonese for Standard Modern Chinese.  The primary objective of the beginning series is to help students build up a repertoire of vocabulary so that they can: (a) introduce themselves in an informal social situation, (b) engage in simple transactions, (c) converse about themselves, their friends and families, and (d) talk about activities in daily lives.  Authentic materials such as Cantopop and movie clips are incorporated in the courses and Internet tools are used to enhance learning.  There is also an optional field trip to a karaoke bar, a dim sum restaurant, or a Cantonese community every quarter to experience Cantonese culture. In addition, students work on common pronunciation and grammatical errors due to influences from Mandarin. Cantonese-Chinese characters will also be taught. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 15M or consent of instructor

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Conversational Cantonese, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 16. This is the third of the 3-course series on beginning Cantonese.  The primary objective of the beginning series is to help students build up a repertoire of vocabulary and basic grammatical structures so that they can: (a) introduce themselves in an informal social situation, (b) engage in simple transactions, (c) converse about themselves, their friends and families, and (d) talk about activities in daily lives.  Authentic materials such as Cantopop and movie clips are incorporated in the courses and Internet tools are used to enhance learning.  There is also an optional field trip to a karaoke bar, a dim-sum restaurant, or a Cantonese community every quarter to experience Cantonese culture. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 16 or consent of instructor.

sections.notes: This class section has been cancelled!

subject: CHINLANG
title: Beginning Conversational Cantonese for Mandarin Speakers, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 16M. This is the third of the 3-course series on beginning Cantonese for Standard Modern Chinese  speakers.  The primary objective of the beginning series is to help students build up a repertoire of vocabulary so that they can: (a) introduce themselves in an informal social situation, (b) engage in simple transactions, (c) converse about themselves, their friends and families, and (d) talk about activities in daily lives.  Authentic materials such as Cantopop and movie clips are incorporated in the courses and Internet tools are used to enhance learning. In addition, students work on common pronunciation and grammatical errors due to influences from Mandarin. Cantonese-Chinese characters will also be taught. Prerequisite:  CHINLANG 16M or consent of instructor

sections.notes: This class section has been cancelled!

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate Conversational Cantonese, First Quarter
description: This is a 3-quarter series of intermediate Cantonese for students who have finished beginning Conversational Cantonese, or its equivalent. The primary objective of the intermediate series is to continue exploring the Cantonese language and culture through engaging activities designed to build on their speaking and listening proficiencies needed in traveling, studying, living, or working in Cantonese-speaking communities. Authentic materials such as classic and popular Cantopop, movie clips, and TV show clips are incorporated in the courses and appropriate online resources are used to facilitate learning. Prerequisite: Beginning Conversational Cantonese sequence or equivalent level (consent of instructor).

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate Conversational Cantonese, Second Quarter
description: This is  a 3-quarter series of intermediate Cantonese for students who have finished beginning Conversational Cantonese, or its equivalent. The primary objective of the intermediate series is to continue exploring the Cantonese language and culture through engaging activities designed to build on their speaking and listening proficiencies needed in traveling, studying, living, or working in Cantonese-speaking communities. Authentic materials such as classic and popular Cantopop, movie clips, and TV show clips are incorporated in the courses and appropriate online resources are used to facilitate learning. Prerequisite: Beginning Conversational Cantonese sequence or equivalent level (consent of instructor).

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate Conversational Cantonese, Third Quarter
description: This is a 3-quarter series of intermediate Cantonese for students who have finished beginning Conversational Cantonese, or its equivalent. The primary objective of the intermediate series is to continue exploring the Cantonese language and culture through engaging activities designed to build on their speaking and listening proficiencies needed in traveling, studying, living, or working in Cantonese-speaking communities. Authentic materials such as classic and popular Cantopop, movie clips, and TV show clips are incorporated in the courses and appropriate online resources are used to facilitate learning. Prerequisite: Beginning Conversational Cantonese sequence or equivalent level (consent of instructor).

subject: CHINLANG
title: Cantonese Through Films, First Quarter
description: This is the first of a series of courses that targets intermediate and low-advanced students interested in expanding their Cantonese repertoire to include vocabulary, grammar, and culture for talking about movies, current events, and topics of interest to them. Students watch authentic Cantonese movies, TV dramas, news clips, and documentaries.  They engage in discussions about topics relevant to them, such as history and identity of Chinese Americans.  There is also an optional field trip to a karaoke bar, a dim sum restaurant, or a Cantonese community every quarter to experience Cantonese culture. Prerequisite: "Cantonese Proficiency Test  or CHINLANG 20.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Cantonese Through Films, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 20A. This is the second of a series of courses that targets intermediate and low-advanced students interested in expanding their Cantonese repertoire to include vocabulary, grammar, and culture for talking about movies, current events, and topics of interest to them. Students watch authentic Cantonese movies, TV dramas, news clips, and documentaries.  They engage in discussions about topics relevant to them, such as history and identity of Chinese Americans.  There is also an optional field trip to a karaoke bar, a dim sum restaurant, or a Cantonese community every quarter to experience Cantonese culture. Prerequisite:  CHINLANG 20A or consent of instructor.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Cantonese Through Films, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 20B. This is the third of a series of courses that targets intermediate and low-advanced students interested in expanding their Cantonese repertoire to include vocabulary, grammar, and culture for talking about movies, current events, and topics of interest to them. Students watch authentic Cantonese movies, TV dramas, news clips, and documentaries.  They engage in discussions about topics relevant to them, such as history and identity of Chinese Americans.  There is also an optional field trip to a karaoke bar, a dim sum restaurant, or a Cantonese community every quarter to experience Cantonese culture. subject: CHINLANG
title: Second-Year Modern Chinese, First Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 3. Listening, speaking, reading, writing. Daily sections may be set at the beginning of the quarter to suit schedule requirements. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 3.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Second-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, First Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 3B. For students with advanced comprehension and speaking skills, but lacking equivalent knowledge of grammar, reading, and writing Chinese characters. Equivalent to CHINLANG 21. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 3B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Second-Year Modern Chinese, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 21. Listening, speaking, reading, writing. Daily sections may be set at the beginning of the quarter to suit schedule requirements. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 21.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Second-Year Chinese for Bilingual Students, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 21B. For students with advanced comprehension and speaking skills, but lacking equivalent knowledge of grammar, reading, and writing Chinese characters. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 21B .

subject: CHINLANG
title: Second-Year Modern Chinese, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 22. Listening, speaking, reading, writing. Daily sections may be set at the beginning of the quarter to suit schedule requirements. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 22.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Second-Year Chinese for Bilingual Students, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 22B. For students with advanced comprehension and speaking skills, but lacking equivalent knowledge of grammar, reading, and writing Chinese characters. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 22B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Advanced Cantonese Conversation
description: This is  a 3-quarter series of advance Cantonese for students who have completed Intermediate Conversational Cantonese, or its equivalent, and wish to continue to develop their speaking and listening skills. The primary objective of the advance series is to continue exploring the Cantonese language and culture through a wide variety of engaging activities and multimedia materials designed to build on their speaking and listening proficiencies needed in traveling, studying, living, or working in Cantonese-speaking communities. Students will be exposed to authentic materials and participating in various activities, such as Cantonese in movies, in-depth discussion on topics related to personal interests, social, community and global issues, interview, documentaries, classic and popular Cantopop, and TV show clips. Appropriate online resources are used to facilitate learning.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Advanced Cantonese Conversation
description: This is the first of a 3-quarter series of advance Cantonese for students who have completed Intermediate Conversational Cantonese, or its equivalent, and wish to continue to develop their speaking and listening skills. The primary objective of the advance series is to continue exploring the Cantonese language and culture through a wide variety of engaging activities and multimedia materials designed to build on their speaking and listening proficiencies needed in traveling, studying, living, or working in Cantonese-speaking communities. Appropriate online resources are used to facilitate learning.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate Chinese Conversation, First Quarter
description: First quarter of the three-quarter sequence.  For students with basic conversational skills in Standard Modern Chinese. Emphasis is on developing learners' communicative competence in Chinese by means of language practices, oral reports, discussions and group projects.  Development of functional language skills for daily communication on topics related to school life, Chinese culture and society.Prerequisite: CHINLANG 3 or consent of instructor.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate Chinese Conversation, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 27.  For students with basic conversational skills in Standard Modern Chinese. Emphasis is on developing learners communicative competence in Chinese by means of language practices, oral reports, discussions and group projects. Development of functional language skills for daily communication on topics related to school life, Chinese culture and society. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 27 or consent of instructor.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate Chinese Conversation, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 28.  For students with basic conversational skills in Standard Modern Chinese. Emphasis is on developing learners' communicative competence in Chinese by means of language practices, oral reports, discussions and group projects. Development of functional language skills for daily communication on topics related to school life, Chinese culture and society. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 28 or consent of instructor

subject: CHINLANG
title: Accelerated Beginning Mandarin for Engineering Students, First Quarter
description: Restricted to engineering students participating in the China Internship Program. . Grad students enroll in CHINLANG 331E.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate-to-Advanced Chinese Conversation, First Quarter
description: Repeatable once for units. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 23.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate-to-Advanced Chinese Conversation, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 41.  Repeatable once for units. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 23.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Intermediate-to-Advanced Chinese Conversation, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 42. Repeatable once for units. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 23.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Chinese Calligraphy
description: Introductory course on Chinese calligraphy. Practice writing Chinese characters with a brush, emphasizing regular/standard script and the composition of the characters. May be repeated for credit.Prerequisite CHINLANG 2 or consent of instructor.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Language Specials
description: Prerequisite: consent of instructor.nn (Staff)

subject: CHINLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Chinese, First Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 23. Written and spoken styles of modern Chinese. Reading and discussion of authentic writings on cultural topics; newspaper reports, radio, and TV broadcasts and films; online Chinese software and email network to facilitate study. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 23.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, First Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 23B. Equivalent to CHINLANG 101. For students with advanced listening and speaking abilities, but lacking equivalent knowledge in reading and writing.  Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 23B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Chinese, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 101. Written and spoken styles of modern Chinese. Reading and discussion of authentic writings on cultural topics; newspaper reports, radio, and TV broadcasts and films; online Chinese software and email network to facilitate study. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 101.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 101B. Equivalent to CHINLANG 102. For students with advanced listening and speaking abilities, but lacking equivalent knowledge in reading and writing. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 101B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Chinese, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 102. Written and spoken styles of modern Chinese. Reading and discussion of authentic writings on cultural topics; newspaper reports, radio, and TV broadcasts and films; online Chinese software and email network to facilitate study Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 102.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 102B. Equivalent of CHINLANG 103. For students with advanced listening and speaking abilities, but lacking equivalent knowledge in reading and writing. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 102B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Advanced Chinese Conversation, First Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 29. This is the first quarter of a three-quarter sequence designed for students who have completed Third-year Chinese, or its equivalent, and wish to continue to develop their speaking and listening skills. Content for the course is drawn from a wide variety of current multimedia materials. Topics include general interest and social issues, international relations, and others that lend themselves to lively and in-depth discussion. New grammatical structures and vocabulary will be regularly introduced, with occasional written assignments to support students, development of conversational skills. Placement Test, CHINLANG 103.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Advanced Chinese Conversation, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 121. Second quarter of Advanced Conversational Chinese. It is designed for students who have completed Third-year Chinese, or its equivalent, and wish to continue to develop their speaking and listening skills. Content for the course is drawn from a wide variety of current multimedia materials. Topics include general interest and social issues, international relations, and others that lend themselves to lively and in-depth discussion. New grammatical structures and vocabulary will be regularly introduced, with occasional written assignments to support students, development of conversational skills. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 121.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Advanced Chinese Conversation, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 122. Third quarter of Advanced Conversational Chinese. It is designed for students who have completed Third-year Chinese, or its equivalent, and wish to continue to develop their speaking and listening skills. Content for the course is drawn from a wide variety of current multimedia materials. Topics include general interest and social issues,international relations, and others that lend themselves to lively and in-depth discussion.  New grammatical structures and vocabulary will be regularly introduced, with occasional written assignments to support development of conversational skills. Prerequisite: Chinlang 122

subject: CHINLANG
title: Chinese through Modern Fiction (CHINLANG 225)
description: Increasing Chinese language proficiency through reading original modern Chinese literary masterpieces covered in Chingen 133/233, including prominent modern Chinese writers such as Lu Xun, Shen Congwen, Ding Ling, Zhang Ailing and Yu Hua. Students will gain Chinese language skills and enhance their understanding of Chinese culture. Enrollment in Chingen 133/233 is not required but encouraged. Prerequisite: Chinlang 103,Chinlang 103B or equivalent (proved by placement test result).

subject: CHINLANG
title: Business Chinese, First Quarter
description: This is the first course in the Business Chinese series. It focuses on expanding students economic and business-related vocabulary and improving their practical language skills in business communications with Chinese-speaking communities. Students will work on a variety of authentic materials, including newspaper and journal articles, TV news and film clips, as well as commentaries from social media. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 103 or equivalent.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Business Chinese, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG131. This is the second course in the Business Chinese series. It focuses on expanding students economic and business-related vocabulary and improving their practical language skills in business communications with Chinese-speaking communities. Students will work on a variety of authentic materials, including newspaper and journal articles, TV news and film clips, as well as commentaries from social media.Prerequisite: Chinlang 131 or consent of instructor

subject: CHINLANG
title: Business Chinese, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG132. This is the third course in the Business Chinese series. It focuses on expanding students economic and business-related vocabulary and improving their practical language skills in business communications with Chinese-speaking communities. Students will work on a variety of authentic materials, including newspaper and journal articles, TV news and film clips, as well as commentaries from social media. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 132.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Directed Reading
description: May be repeated for credit. Prerequisite: consent of instructor.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Fourth-Year Modern Chinese, First Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 103. This is the first quarter of a three-quarter sequence designed for students with advanced-level proficiency in Chinese.  Discussions are based on short stories, essays and newspaper articles, and academic journal articles.  Emphasis is on social and cultural issues in contemporary China.  Students will learn speed-reading techniques and explore more subtle distinctions in Chinese language use, such as formal vs. informal styles and word choice, toward developing a more sophisticated understanding and command of the language. Having completed one year of study at this level, students will acquire sufficient skills in reading, writing, and speaking on various topics of personal or academic interest more effectively and accurately. Prerequisite: placement test, CHINLANG 103.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Fourth- Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, First Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 103B. This is the first quarter of a three-quarter sequence designed for bilingual students with advanced-level proficiency in Chinese.  Discussions are based on short stories, essays and newspaper articles, along with related media materials.  Emphasis is on social and cultural issues in contemporary China.  Students will learn speed-reading techniques and explore more subtle distinctions in Chinese language use, such as formal vs. informal styles and word choice, toward developing a more sophisticated understanding and command of the language. Having completed one year of study at this level, students will acquire sufficient skills in reading, writing, and speaking on various topics of personal or public interests more effectively and accurately. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 103B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Fourth-Year Modern Chinese, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 211. Second quarter of fourth year Chinese. Discussions are based on short stories, essays and newspaper articles, and academic journal articles. Emphasis is on social and cultural issues in contemporary China. Students will learn speed-reading techniques and explore more subtle distinctions in Chinese language use, such as formal vs. informal styles and word choice, toward developing a more sophisticated understanding and command of the language. Having completed one year of study at this level, students will acquire sufficient skills in reading, writing, and speaking on various topics of personal or academic interest more effectively and accurately. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 211.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Fourth-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 211B. Second quarter of Fourth Year Chinese for bilingual students. Discussions are based on short stories, essays and newspaper articles, along with related media materials. Emphasis is on social and cultural issues in contemporary China. Students will learn speed-reading techniques and explore more subtle distinctions in Chinese language use, such as formal vs. informal styles and word choice, toward developing a more sophisticated understanding and command of the language. Having completed one year of study at this level, students will acquire sufficient skills in reading, writing, and speaking on various topics of personal or public interests more effectively and accurately. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 211B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Fourth-Year Modern Chinese, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG 212. Third quarter of Fourth Year Chinese. Discussions are based on short stories, essays and newspaper articles, and academic journal articles. Emphasis is on social and cultural issues in contemporary China. Students will learn speed-reading techniques and explore more subtle distinctions in Chinese language use, such as formal vs. informal styles and word choice, toward developing a more sophisticated understanding and command of the language.Having completed one year of study at this level, students will acquire sufficient skills in reading, writing, and speaking on various topics of personal or academic interest more effectively and accurately. Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 212.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Fourth-Year Modern Chinese for Bilingual Students, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of CHINLANG  212B.  Third quarter of Fourth Year Chinese for bilingual students. Discussions are based on short stories, essays and newspaper articles, along with related media materials. Emphasis is on social and cultural issues in contemporary China. Students will learn speed-reading techniques and explore more subtle distinctions in Chinese language use, such as formal vs. informal styles and word choice, toward developing a more sophisticated understanding and command of the language. Having completed one year of study at this level, students will acquire sufficient skills in reading, writing, and speaking on various topics of personal or public interests more effectively and accurately. Prerequisite: CHINLANG 212B.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Chinese through Modern Fiction (CHINLANG 125)
description: Increasing Chinese language proficiency through reading original modern Chinese literary masterpieces covered in Chingen 133/233, including prominent modern Chinese writers such as Lu Xun, Shen Congwen, Ding Ling, Zhang Ailing and Yu Hua. Students will gain Chinese language skills and enhance their understanding of Chinese culture. Enrollment in Chingen 133/233 is not required but encouraged. Prerequisite: Chinlang 103,Chinlang 103B or equivalent (proved by placement test result).

subject: CHINLANG
title: Fifth-Year Modern Chinese: Current Issues, First Quarter
description: One of the two components of fifth-year Chinese, first quarter: A content focuses on politics, the economy, technology and society. Sequence facilitates advanced training in listening, speaking, reading and writing. Targeted functional abilities include presentational and sociocultural appropriate language in formal and informal, academic, and professional contexts. Students can take Chinlang 231A alone for 2 units, or take 231A concurrently with Chinlang 231B for 4 units.

subject: CHINLANG
title: Fifth-Year Modern Chinese: Cultural Texts, First Quarter
description: One of the two components of fifth-year Chinese, first quarter: 'B' content includes cultural and literary texts in the form of dramas, fictional pieces, poetry, essays, TV shows and films.  Sequence facilitates advanced training in listening, speaking, reading and writing.  Targeted functional abilities include presentational and socioculturally appropriate language in formal and informal, academic, and professional contexts.  Students can take 231B alone for 2 units, or take 231B concurrently with 231A for 4 units.  Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 213, or CHINLANG 213B.

Sequence facilitates advanced training in listening, speaking, reading and writing.  Targeted functional abilities include presentational and socioculturally appropriate language in formal and informal, academic, and professional contexts.  Students can take 232A alone for 2 units, or take 232A concurrently with 232B for 4 units.  Prerequisite: Placement Test, CHINLANG 231A, or CHINLANG 231B.

subject: CHINLANG

description: One of the two components of fifth-year Chinese, third quarter: 'B' content includes cultural and literary texts in the form of dramas, fictional pieces, poetry, essays, TV shows and films.  Sequence facilitates advanced training in listening, speaking, reading and writing.  Targeted functional abilities include presentational and socioculturally appropriate language in formal and informal, academic, and professional contexts. subject: CHINLANG
title: Chinese for Academic Discussion and Reading
description: This course is designed to provide an opportunity for PhD students, as well as Masters or senior undergraduate students with specific academic projects to practice, improve, and refine their Chinese skills. Students will share with the class reading materials related to their academic research projects, and take the leading role in related class discussion. They will additionally write about their research topics and present their research ideas and discoveries to the class. We hope these practices can help students communicate more effectively in a Chinese academic environment, and allow them to improve the presentation skills they will use at Chinese-speaking academic conferences. This course is repeatable. Prerequisite: 213/213B or equivalent and approval of instructor (Email instructor for permission).

subject: CHINLANG
title: Accelerated Beginning Mandarin for Engineering Students, First Quarter
description: Restricted to graduate engineering students participating in the China Internship Program..
